title: Fernando Azevedo e Silva
text:
Fernando Azevedo e Silva (born 4 February 1954) is a Brazilian politician and reserve <a href="Brazilian%20Army">army</a> general. He served as the Brazilian <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28Brazil%29">Minister of Defence</a> during the first half of President <a href="Jair%20Bolsonaro">Jair Bolsonaro</a>'s term from January 2019 to March 2021.
He graduated as <a href="Infantry">Infantry</a> Officer on December 14, 1976, at the <a href="Academia%20Militar%20das%20Agulhas%20Negras">Academia Militar das Agulhas Negras</a>, and was promoted to <a href="Army%20general">Army general</a> (four stars rank) on July 31, 2014.
He was assistant to <a href="Supreme%20Federal%20Court">Supreme Federal Court</a> Chief Justice <a href="Dias%20Toffoli">Dias Toffoli</a>. On 13 November 2018, he was named by President-elect <a href="Jair%20Bolsonaro">Jair Bolsonaro</a> as his choice for <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28Brazil%29">Minister of Defence</a>, replacing previous nominee <a href="Augusto%20Heleno">Augusto Heleno</a>, who was instead named as head of the <a href="Institutional%20Security%20Office%20of%20Brazil">Institutional Security Office</a>. On March 29, 2021 Azevedo resigned, along with the five other ministers.
